The formation of Anh‐B was not expected and is a priori surprising since the annealing was carried out in the stability field of wadsleyite (which is indeed observed). To synthesize Anh‐B, Ganguly and Frost ( 2006) started with oxide mixtures, which corresponded to a composition enriched in MgO compared to forsterite. In this system, our conditions (14 GPa, 1400 °C) would indeed favor the formation of Anh‐B (see Figure 1 of Ganguly & Frost, 2006, and also the results of calculations from Ottonello et al., 2010, from their Figure 6).
